intro: Petrorhagia phthiotica, commonly known as the Phthiotis rock rose, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Greece. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its compact growth habit and vibrant pink to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky and arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its foliage consists of narrow, linear leaves that help reduce water loss, a feature common in xerophytic species. Petrorhagia phthiotica is often used in rock gardens and as a drought-tolerant ornamental plant.
